 Volume 
 





Foreign relations of the United States: diplomatic papers, 1945. General : political and economic matters
Source:
United States Department of State
Foreign relations of the United States: diplomatic papers, 1945. General : political and economic matters
Volume II
U.S. Government Printing Office, 1945
URL to cite for this work: http://digital.library.wisc.edu/1711.dl/FRUS.FRUS1945v02





Search for word or phrase within this work: 



Contents

[Cover]
[Title page] Foreign relations of the United States diplomatic papers, 1945: volume II. General: political and economic matters, pp. [I]-[II]
Preface, Franklin, William M. pp. III-IV
Contents, pp. V-VI
Acquisition of materials for use in the development of the atomic bomb; efforts to establish a system of international control of atomic energy, pp. 1-98
First session of the Council of Foreign Ministers, London, September 11-October 2, 1945, pp. 99-559
Moscow conference of foreign ministers, December 16-26, 1945, pp. 560-826
Anglo-American cooperation on policies and problems concerning the Proclaimed and Statutory Lists in the Eastern Hemisphere, pp. 827-851
Concern of the United States over enemy attempts to secrete funds or other assets in neutral countries; implementation of the Safehaven program, pp. 852-932
Interest of the United States in measures for the protection and salvage of artistic and historic monuments in war areas, pp. 933-957
Participation by the United States in the work of the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration (UNRRA), pp. 958-1058
Anglo-American negotiations relating to the provision of civilian supplies for liberated areas; the Rosenman mission, pp. 1059-1116
First session of conference of the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization, held at Quebec, October 16-November 1, 1945, p. 1117
Protocol signed August 31, 1945, at London, extending the duration of the International sugar agreement of 1937, p. 1118
Interest of the United States in the relief and rescue of Jews and security detainees in Germany and German-occupied territory, pp. 1119-1145
Concern of the United States over problems involving displaced and stateless persons and refugees, pp. 1146-1226
Interest of the United States in the transfer of German populations from Poland, Czechoslovakia, Hungary, Rumania, and Austria, pp. 1227-1327
Interest of the United States in the convening of an international conference on trade and employment, pp. 1328-1360
Concern of the United States over implementation of the 1944 agreement on principles having reference to the continuance of coordinated control of merchant shipping, p. 1361
Participation by the United States in a plan for the international control of postwar mine clearance in European waters, pp. 1362-1363
Discussions relating to the establishment of an international regime for the administration of European inland waterways, pp. 1364-1388
European Inland Transport Conference, October 10, 1944-September 27, 1945; formation of the European Inland Transport Organization, pp. 1389-1410
Interest of the United States in the establishment of the emergency Economic Committee for Europe and the European Coal Organization, pp. 1411-1454
Interest of the United States in international civil aviation matters, pp. 1455-1480
Formulation of United States policy on the resources of the Continental Shelf and on coastal fisheries, pp. 1481-1530
International whaling conference, London, November 1945, and protocol signed November 26, p. 1531
Interest of the United States to secure cooperation among interested governments on measures to limit and control production and to suppress illicit traffic in opium, pp. 1532-1540
Participation of the United States in the Rubber Study Group, p. 1541
Participation of the United States in the work of the International Wheat Council, p. 1542
Participation of the United States in the fourth meeting of the International Cotton Advisory Committee, April 2-14, 1945, p. [1543]
Participation of the United States in international scientific meetings, p. 1544
Index, pp. [1545]-1577 ff.
[Cover]
